physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white portrait photograph of Tan cheng Siang. He is seated on a chair
 gazing forward towards the viewer. He is wearing a double breasted suit with a bouteonniere and pocket watch
 sitting against a plain backdrop with a panama hat on the left. There is a signature stamp on the bottom-right of the photograph.
subject_terms_1:Peranakan businessmen photographs
subject_terms_2:Portrait photography Peranakan (Asian people) Businessmen Photographs
subject_terms_3:Portrait photography Tan
 Kim Tian Peranakan clans and associations
sgcool_label_text:Tan Cheng Siang(1885-1977) looks out confidently at the viewer in this studio photograph. Wearing a double breasted suit
 complete with a boutonniere and pocket watch
 he sits before a plain backdrop with a panama hat by his side. The shop mark ‘Koon Sun Photographer
 Singapore’ can be seen on the photograph. Koon Sun Photo Studio was located along South Bridge Road in Singapore’s city centre. It was one of the two photographic studios established by Lee Tat Loon and Lee Tit Loon
 whose son went on to found Lee Brothers Studio. This photograph came from the collection of Botan House
 the ancestral home built by Tan Kim Tian.

metadata.title_text: Photograph of Tan Cheng Siang Tan Cheng Siang
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph of Tan cheng Siang. He is seated on a chair, gazing forward towards the viewer. He is wearing a double breasted suit with a bouteonniere and pocket watch, sitting against a plain backdrop with a panama hat on the left. There is a signature stamp on the bottom-right of the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Portrait photography Peranakan (Asian people) Businessmen Photographs
metadata.subject_terms_3: Portrait photography Tan, Kim Tian Peranakan clans and associations
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Tan Cheng Siang(1885-1977) looks out confidently at the viewer in this studio photograph. Wearing a double breasted suit, complete with a boutonniere and pocket watch, he sits before a plain backdrop with a panama hat by his side. The shop mark ‘Koon Sun Photographer, Singapore’ can be seen on the photograph. Koon Sun Photo Studio was located along South Bridge Road in Singapore’s city centre. It was one of the two photographic studios established by Lee Tat Loon and Lee Tit Loon, whose son went on to found Lee Brothers Studio. This photograph came from the collection of Botan House, the ancestral home built by Tan Kim Tian.
